section.title: Content Assist
section.para: Anyframe Query Manager enables more convenient and faster edition and utilization of Query statement by providing Content Assist function. Users can utilize functions provided by Content Assist of Anyframe Query Manager through keyboard shortcut key(default: Ctrl+Space) like other Content Assist.

section.title: Content Assist environment setting
section.para: You can set Content Assist at "Java > Editor > Content Assist > Advanced" of Eclipse Preferences and decide whether Content Assist of Anyframe Query Manager will be called by shortcut key.

section.title: Query Proposal of Content Assist
section.para: For DAO(when either utilizing IQueryService or inheriting AbstractDAO) of Anyframe at Eclipse Java Editor, Content Assist shows the candidate list for the Query ID. This function is provided when Content Assist is called through keyboard shortcut key at Query input part (" " part in String type) which Query service method gets as a parameter.

note.title: Note:when searching/entering candidate list for Query ID through Content Assist
note.para: When the method is create(), findByPk(), findListWithPaging(), update(), remove(), etc. inheriting from AbstractDAO, the only Query statement that follow prefix and suffix rules set in Preferences of Anyframe Query Manager through Content Assist is searched.

section.title: Query Mapping XML edition support of Content Assist
section.para: When editing Query at Source tab of Query Manager Editor at Anyframe Query Manager, candidate list for Query Mapping XML tag and attribute is shown.

section.title: Providing navigation between Query and Java code.
section.para: Navigation between Query and Java code is possible, and which supports the following cases.

listitem.para: Moving from Query Manager Editor to Result Class(VO) (Context Menu: Open Class in Java Editor)
Moving from Query Service DAO to Query (Context Menu: Open Query in Query Manager Editor)
